title: Firefox (org.mozilla.firefox)
description: Configures Firefox settings. Firefox 78 is the last major release with support for macOS versions 10.9, 10.10 and 10.11.

BackgroundAppUpdate.title: Background App Update
BackgroundAppUpdate.description: Enable or disable automatic application update in the background, when the application is not running. If set to true, application updates may be installed (without user approval) in the background, even when the application is not running. The operating system might still require approval.

AppAutoUpdate.title: Firefox Auto Update
AppAutoUpdate.description: Enable or disable automatic application update.

AppUpdateURL.title: Application Update URL
AppUpdateURL.description: Change the URL for application update.

Authentication.description: Configure sites that support integrated authentication.

SPNEGO.title: SPNEGO
SPNEGO.description:
If this preference is enabled, the specified websites are permitted to engage in SPNEGO authentication with the browser. Entries in the list are formatted as mydomain.com or https://myotherdomain.com.

If this preference is disabled or not configured, no websites are permitted to engage in SPNEGO authentication with the browser.

For more information, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Integrated_authentication.

Delegated.title: Delegated
Delegated.description:
If this preference is enabled, the browser may delegate user authorization to the server for the specified websites. Entries in the list are formatted as mydomain.com or https://myotherdomain.com.

If this preference is disabled or not configured, the browser will not delegate user authorization to the server for any websites.

For more information, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Integrated_authentication

NTLM.title: Microsoft Challenge/Response (NTLM)
NTLM.description:
If this preference is enabled, the specified websites are trusted to use NTLM authentification. Entries in the list are formatted as mydomain.com or https://myotherdomain.com.

If this policy is disabled or not configured, no websites are trusted to use NTLM authentification.

For more information, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Integrated_authentication.

AllowNonFQDN.title: Allow Non-FQDN
AllowNonFQDN.description: If this preference is enabled, you can always allow SPNEGO or NTLM on non FQDNs (fully qualified domain names). If this preference is disabled or not configured, NTLM and SPNEGO are not enabled on non FQDNs.

AllowProxies.title: Allow Proxies
AllowProxies.description: If this preference is enabled, you can always allow SPNEGO or NTLM on non FQDNs (fully qualified domain names). If this preference is disabled or not configured, NTLM and SPNEGO are not enabled on non FQDNs.

PrivateBrowsing.title: Private Browsing
PrivateBrowsing.description: Enables integrated authentication in prviate browsing

BlockAboutAddons.title: Block about:addons page
BlockAboutAddons.description: Block access to the Add-ons Manager (about:addons).

URL.description: Full URL to be bookmarked (e.g. https://www.example.org/)

Placement.description: Place bookmark in either the Bookmark menu or Bookmark Toolbar.

Favicon.description: URL to icon file to display on bookmark (e.g. https://www.example.org/favicon.ico)

Folder.description: Folder to place bookmark in. If a folder is specified, it is automatically created and bookmarks with the same folder name are grouped together. You cannot nest folders.

Bookmarks.description: Add bookmarks in either the bookmarks toolbar or menu.

DisableBuiltinPDFViewer.title: Disable Built-in PDF Viewer
DisableBuiltinPDFViewer.description: Disable the built in PDF viewer. PDF files are downloaded and sent externally.

PDFjs.title: PDF.js
PDFjs.description: Disable or configure PDF.js, the built-in PDF viewer.

Enabled.description: If Enabled is set to false, the built-in PDF viewer is disabled.

EnablePermissions.description: If EnablePermissions is set to true, the built-in PDF viewer will honor document permissions like preventing the copying of text.

DisableDeveloperTools.title: Disable Developer Tools
DisableDeveloperTools.description: Remove access to all developer tools.

DisableFeedbackCommands.title: Disable Feedback Commands
DisableFeedbackCommands.description: Disable the menus for reporting sites (Submit Feedback, Report Deceptive Site).

DisableMasterPasswordCreation.title: Disable Master Password Creation
DisableMasterPasswordCreation.description: Remove the master password functionality. If this preference is set to true, the master password functionality is removed.

PrimaryPassword.title: Enable Primary Password
PrimaryPassword.description: Require or prevent using a primary (formerly master) password. If this value is true, a primary password is required.

DisablePocket.title: Disable Pocket
DisablePocket.description: Remove Pocket in the Firefox UI.

DisableProfileImport.title: Disable Profile Import
DisableProfileImport.description: Disables the "Import data from another browser" option in the bookmarks window.

DisableProfileRefresh.title: Disable Profile Refresh
DisableProfileRefresh.description: Disable the Refresh Firefox button on about:support and support.mozilla.org, as well as the prompt that displays offering to refresh Firefox when you haven't used it in a while.

DisableSafeMode.title: Disable Safe Mode
DisableSafeMode.description: Disable safe mode within the browser.

DisableSetDesktopBackground.title: Disable Set Desktop Background
DisableSetDesktopBackground.description: This preference removes the "Set As Desktop Background..." menu item when right clicking on an image.

DisplayMenuBar.title: Display Menu Bar
DisplayMenuBar.description: Set the initial state of the menubar. A user can still hide it and it will stay hidden.

DisableSystemAddonUpdate.title: Disable System Add-on Update
DisableSystemAddonUpdate.description: Prevent system add-ons from being installed or update.

DisplayBookmarksToolbar.title: Display Bookmarks Toolbar
DisplayBookmarksToolbar.description: Set the initial state of the bookmarks toolbar. A user can still hide it and it will stay hidden.

DontCheckDefaultBrowser.title: Do Not Check Default Browser
DontCheckDefaultBrowser.description: Don't check if Firefox is the default browser at startup.

DownloadDirectory.title: Download Directory
DownloadDirectory.description: Set and lock the download directory.

Extensions.description: Control the installation, uninstallation and locking of extensions. Locked extensions cannot be disabled or uninstalled. For Install, you specify a list of URLs or paths. For Uninstall and Locked, you specify extension IDs.

Install.title: Install
Install.description: A list of URLs or native paths for extensions to be installed.

Uninstall.title: Uninstall
Uninstall.description: A list of extension IDs that should be uninstalled if found.

Locked.title: Locked
Locked.description: A list of extension IDs that the user cannot disable or uninstall.

ExtensionSettings.description: Manage all aspects of extensions. A default configuration can be set for the special ID "*", which will apply to all extensions that don't have a custom configuration set in this policy.

installation_mode.title: Installation Mode
installation_mode.description: Maps to a string indicating the installation mode for the extension.

install_url.title: Install URL
install_url.description: Maps to a string indicating where Firefox can download a force_installed or normal_installed extension. If installing from the addons.mozilla.org, use the following URL (substituting SHORT_NAME from the URL on AMO), https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/downloads/latest/SHORT_NAME/latest.xpi. If installing from the local file system, use a file:/// URL. Languages packs are available from https://releases.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/VERSION/PLATFORM/xpi/LANGUAGE.xpi.

install_sources.title: Install Sources
install_sources.description: Each item in this list is an extension-style match pattern.

allowed_types.title: Allowed Types
allowed_types.description: This setting allowlists the allowed types of extension/apps that can be installed in Firefox.

blocked_install_message.description: This maps to a string specifying the error message to display to users if they're blocked from installing an extension.

restricted_domains.title: Restricted Domains
restricted_domains.description: An array of domains on which content scripts can't be run.

updates_disabled.title: Disable Updates
updates_disabled.description: Indicates whether or not to disable automatic updates for an individual extension.

EncryptedMediaExtensions.title: Encrypted Media Extensions
EncryptedMediaExtensions.description: Enable or disable Encrypted Media Extensions and optionally lock it.

Enabled.description: If Enabled is set to false, encrypted media extensions (like Widevine) are not downloaded by Firefox unless the user consents to installing them.

Locked.description: If Locked is set to true and Enabled is set to false, Firefox will not download encrypted media extensions (like Widevine) or ask the user to install them.

Homepage.description: Configure the default homepage and how Firefox starts.

URL.description: Optional. Set the default home page.

StartPage.title: Start Page
StartPage.description: Optional. This preference sets what displays when Firefox starts. It can be the homepage, the previous session, or a blank page.

Locked.description: If true, prevents the user from changing homepage preferences.

ShowHomeButton.title: Show Home Button
ShowHomeButton.description: Show the home button on the toolbar.

LocalFileLinks.title: Local File Links
LocalFileLinks.description: Enable linking to local files by origin

NewTabPage.title: New Tab Page
NewTabPage.description: Enable or disable the New Tab page.

NoDefaultBookmarks.title: No Default Bookmarks
NoDefaultBookmarks.description: Disable the creation of default bookmarks.

OverrideFirstRunPage.title: Override First Run Page
OverrideFirstRunPage.description: Override the first run page. If the value is blank, no first run page is displayed. Starting with Firefox 83, Firefox ESR 78.5, you can also specify multiple URLS separated by a vertical bar (|).

OverridePostUpdatePage.title: Override Post Update Page
OverridePostUpdatePage.description: Override the upgrade page. If the value is blank, no upgrade page is displayed.

PromptForDownloadLocation.title: Prompt for Download Location
PromptForDownloadLocation.description: Ask where to save each file before downloading.

RequestedLocales.title: Requested Locales
RequestedLocales.description: Set the the list of requested locales for the application in order of preference. It will cause the corresponding language pack to become active.

SanitizeOnShutdown.title: Sanitize On Shutdown (Selective)
SanitizeOnShutdown.description: Clear data on shutdown. Choose from Cache, Cookies, Download History, Form & Search History, Browsing History, Active Logins, Site Preferences and Offline Website Data.

SearchBar.title: Search Bar
SearchBar.description: Set whether or not search bar is displayed.

SearchEngines.title: Search Engines
SearchEngines.description: Set whether or not search bar is displayed.

Default.description: Set the default search engine. This policy is only available on the ESR.

PreventInstalls.description: Prevent installing search engines from webpages. This policy is only available on the ESR.

Remove.description: Hide built-in search engines. This policy is only available on the ESR.

IconURL.description: URL for the icon to use

Alias.description: keyword to use for the engine

PostData.description: POST data as name value pairs separated by '&'

SuggestURLTemplate.description: Search suggestions URL with {searchTerms} to substitute for the search term.

Encoding.description: The query charset for the engine.

Add.title: Add Search Engines
Add.description: Add new search engines. This policy is only available on the ESR.

Handlers.description: Configure default application handlers. This policy is based on the internal format of handlers.json. You can configure handlers based on a mime type (mimeTypes), a file's extension (extensions), or a protocol (schemes).

mimeTypes.title: MIME Types
mimeTypes.description: Specify MIME types. More info here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types

action.title: Action
action.description: Can be either saveToDisk, useHelperApp, useSystemDefault.

ask.title: Ask
ask.description: If true, the user is asked if what they want to do with the file. If false, the action is taken without user intervention.

action.title: Action
action.description: Can be either saveToDisk, useHelperApp, useSystemDefault.

ask.title: Ask
ask.description: If true, the user is asked if what they want to do with the file. If false, the action is taken without user intervention.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the handler (might not be used).

path.title: Path
path.description: The native path to the executable to be used.

uriTemplate.title: URI Template
uriTemplate.description: A url to a web based application handler. The URL must be https and contain a %s to be used for substitution.

handlers.title: Handlers
handlers.description: An array of handlers with the first one being the default. If you don't want to have a default handler, use an empty object for the first handler. Choose between path or uriTemplate.

action.title: Action
action.description: Can be either saveToDisk, useHelperApp, useSystemDefault.

ask.title: Ask
ask.description: If true, the user is asked if what they want to do with the file. If false, the action is taken without user intervention.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the handler (might not be used).

path.title: Path
path.description: The native path to the executable to be used.

uriTemplate.title: URI Template
uriTemplate.description: A url to a web based application handler. The URL must be https and contain a %s to be used for substitution.

handlers.title: Handlers
handlers.description: An array of handlers with the first one being the default. If you don't want to have a default handler, use an empty object for the first handler. Choose between path or uriTemplate.

DisabledCiphers.title: Disabled Ciphers
DisabledCiphers.description: Disable specific cryptographic ciphers. This policy was updated in Firefox 78 to allow enabling ciphers as well. Setting the value to true disables the cipher, setting the value to false enables the cipher. Previously setting the value to true or false disabled the cipher.

ProviderURL.title: Provider URL
ProviderURL.description: URL to an alternative DNS over HTTPS provider.

Locked.description: If this is true, DNS over HTTPS preferences cannot be changed.

ExcludedDomains.title: Excluded Domains
ExcludedDomains.description: List of excluded domains from DNS over HTTPS.

Proxy.description: Configure proxy settings. These settings correspond to the connection settings in Firefox preferences. To specify ports, append them to the hostnames with a colon (:).

Mode.description: If this preference is enabled, you will be setting the proxy mode.

Locked.description: If this preference is enabled, Proxy preferences cannot be changed.

AutoLogin.description: If this preference is enabled, do not prompt for authentication if password is saved.

UseProxyForDNS.description: If this preference is enabled, you will use Proxy DNS when using SOCKS v5.

UseHTTPProxyForAllProtocols.description: If this preference is enabled, use the HTTP proxy server for all protocols.

NetworkPrediction.title: Network Prediction
NetworkPrediction.description: Enable or disable network prediction (DNS prefetching).

Allow.title: Allow
Allow.description: A list of origins (not domains) where cookies are always allowed.

AllowSession.title: Allow Session
AllowSession.description: A list of origins (not domains) where cookies are only allowed for the current session.

Block.title: Block
Block.description: A list of origins (not domains) where cookies are always blocked.

Behavior.description: This has been added replacing the existing options Default, AcceptThirdParty, and RejectTracker.

Default.description: This sets the default value for "Accept cookies from websites".

AcceptThirdParty.description: This sets the default value for "Accept third-party cookies".

Locked.description: If this is true, cookies preferences cannot be changed.

DisableFormHistory.title: Disable Form History
DisableFormHistory.description: Turn off saving information on web forms and the search bar.

DisablePasswordReveal.title: Disable Password Reveal
DisablePasswordReveal.description: Do not allow passwords to be shown in saved logins

DisableTelemetry.title: Disable Telemetry
DisableTelemetry.description: Prevent the upload of telemetry data.

EnableTrackingProtection.title: Enable Tracking Protection
EnableTrackingProtection.description: Configure tracking protection. If this policy is not configured, tracking protection is not enabled by default in the browser, but it is enabled by default in private browsing and the user can change it.

Value.description: If Value is set to false, tracking protection is disabled and locked in both the regular browser and private browsing. If Value is set to true, tracking protection is enabled by default in both the regular browser and private browsing.

Locked.description: If this is true, Tracking Protection preferences cannot be changed.

Cryptomining.description: If Cryptomining is set to true, cryptomining scripts on websites are blocked.

Fingerprinting.description: If Fingerprinting is set to true, fingerprinting scripts on websites are blocked.

FlashPlugin.title: Flash Plugin Permissions
FlashPlugin.description: Configure the default Flash plugin policy as well as origins for which Flash is allowed.

Allow.title: Allowed Domains
Allow.description: If this preference is enabled, sites on the allow list do not override Flash being completely disabled. Flash is activated by default for the domains indicated unless Flash is completely disabled. If a top level domain is specified (http://example.org), Flash is allowed for all subdomains as well.

Block.title: Blocked Domains
Block.description: If this preference is enabled, Flash is blocked for the domains indicated. If a top level domain is specified (http://example.org), Flash is blocked from all subdomains as well.

Default.description: If this is true, Flash preferences cannot be changed. If this is false, Flash is never activated on websites even if they are in the specified in the Allow list.

Locked.description: If this is true, Flash preferences cannot be changed.

InstallAddonsPermission.title: Install Add-ons Permissions
InstallAddonsPermission.description: Configure the default extension install policy as well as origins for extension installs are allowed.

Allow.title: Allowed Domains
Allow.description: If this preference is enabled, add-ons are always allowed for the domains indicated unless add-on install is disabled. If a top level domain is specified (http://example.org), add-ons are allowed for all subdomains as well.

Default.description: If this is set to false, add-ons cannot be installed by the user.

OfferToSaveLogins.title: Offer To Save Logins
OfferToSaveLogins.description: Control whether or not Firefox offers to save passwords.

OfferToSaveLoginsDefault.title: Offer To Save Logins Default
OfferToSaveLoginsDefault.description: Sets the default value of signon.rememberSignons without locking it.

PasswordManagerEnabled.title: Enable Password Manager
PasswordManagerEnabled.description: Remove access to the password manager via preferences and blocks about:logins on Firefox 70.

Permissions.description: Set permissions associated with camera, microphone, location, notifications, and autoplay.

Camera.title: Camera Permissions
Camera.description: This preference allows you to change the camera permissions.

Allow.description: If this preference is enabled, access to the camera is always allowed for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the default camera preference is followed.

Block.description: If this preference is enabled, access to the camera is blocked for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, access to the camera is not blocked by default.

BlockNewRequests.title: Block New Requests
BlockNewRequests.description: If this preference is enabled, sites that are not in the Allow preference will not be allowed to ask permission to access the camera. If this preference is disabled or not configured, any site that is not in the Block preference can ask permission to access the camera.

Locked.description: If this preference is enabled, camera preferences cannot be changed by the user. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the user can change their camera preferences.

Microphone.title: Microphone Permissions
Microphone.description: This preference allows you to change the microphone permissions.

Allow.description: If this preference is enabled, access to the microphone is always allowed for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the default microphone preference is followed.

Block.description: If this preference is enabled, access to the microphone is blocked for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, access to the microphone is not blocked by default.

BlockNewRequests.title: Block New Requests
BlockNewRequests.description: If this preference is enabled, sites that are not in the Allow preference will not be allowed to ask permission to access the microphone. If this preference is disabled or not configured, any site that is not in the Block preference can ask permission to access the microphone.

Locked.description: If this preference is enabled, microphone preferences cannot be changed by the user. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the user can change their microphone preferences.

Location.title: Location Permissions
Location.description: This preference allows you to change the location permissions.

Allow.description: If this preference is enabled, access to location is always allowed for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the default location preference is followed.

Block.description: If this preference is enabled, access to location is blocked for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, access to location is not blocked by default.

BlockNewRequests.title: Block New Requests
BlockNewRequests.description: If this preference is enabled, sites that are not in the Allow preference will not be allowed to ask permission to access location. If this preference is disabled or not configured, any site that is not in the Block preference can ask permission to access the location.

Locked.description: If this preference is enabled, location preferences cannot be changed by the user. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the user can change their location preferences.

Notifications.title: Notifications Permissions
Notifications.description: This preference allows you to change the notifications permissions.

Allow.description: If this preference is enabled, notifications can always be sent for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the default nofication preference is followed.

Block.description: If this preference is enabled, notifications are always blocked for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, notifications are not blocked by default.

BlockNewRequests.title: Block New Requests
BlockNewRequests.description: If this preference is enabled, sites that are not in the Allow preference will not be allowed to ask permission to send notifications. If this preference is disabled or not configured, any site that is not in the Block preference can ask permission to send notifications.

Locked.description: If this preference is enabled, notification preferences cannot be changed by the user. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the user can change their notification preferences.

Autoplay.title: Autoplay Permissions
Autoplay.description: This preference allows you to change the autoplay permissions.

Allow.description: If this preference is enabled, autoplay can always be enabled for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the default autoplay preference is followed.

Block.description: If this preference is enabled, autoplay are always blocked for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, autoplay is not blocked by default.

Locked.title: Locked
Locked.description: If this preference is enabled, autoplay preferences cannot be changed by the user. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the user can change their autoplay preferences.

VirtualReality.title: Virutal Reality Permissions
VirtualReality.description: This preference allows you to change the virtual reality permissions.

Allow.description: If this preference is enabled, access to virtual reality is always allowed for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the default virtual reality preference is followed.

Block.description: If this preference is enabled, access to virtual reality is blocked for the domains indicated. If this preference is disabled or not configured, access to the virtual reality is not blocked by default.

BlockNewRequests.title: Block New Requests
BlockNewRequests.description: If this preference is enabled, sites that are not in the Allow preference will not be allowed to ask permission to access virtual reality. If this preference is disabled or not configured, any site that is not in the Block preference can ask permission to access virtual reality.

Locked.description: If this preference is enabled, virtual reality preferences cannot be changed by the user. If this preference is disabled or not configured, the user can change their virtual reality preferences.

PopupBlocking.title: Popup Blocking
PopupBlocking.description: Configure the default pop-up window policy as well as origins for which pop-up windows are allowed.

Allow.title: Allowed Domains
Allow.description: Specify the domains for which pop-up windows are always allowed. If a top level domain is specified (http://example.org), pop-up windows are allowed for all subdomains as well.

Default.description: If this is false, pop-up windows are allowed by default.

Locked.description: If this is true, pop-up blocking preferences cannot be changed.

Certificates.description: Trust certificates that have been added to the operating system certificate store by a user or administrator in the macOS Keychain.

ImportEnterpriseRoots.description: If this preference is enabled, Firefox will read certificates from the macOS keychain. If this preference is disabled or not configured, Firefox will not read certificates from the macOS keychain.

Install.title: Install
Install.description:
If this preference is enabled, Firefox will install the listed certificates. It will look in /Library/Application Support/Mozilla/Certificates and ~/Library/Application Support/Mozilla/Certificates.

If this preference is disabled or not configured, Firefox will not install additional certificates.

Starting in Firefox 65, you can specify a fully qualified path (e.g. /Library/Company/cer1.der). If Firefox does not find something at your fully qualified path, it will search the default directories.

DisableSecurityBypass.title: Disable Security Bypass
DisableSecurityBypass.description: Prevent the user from bypassing security in certain cases.

InvalidCertificate.description: Prevents adding an exception when an invalid certificate is shown. If this preference is enabled, the "Add Exception" button is not available when a certificate is invalid. This prevents the user from overriding the certificate error. If this preference is disabled or not configured, certificate errors can be overridden.

SafeBrowsing.description: Prevents selecting "ignore the risk" and visiting a harmful site anyway. If this preference is enabled, a user cannot bypass the warning and visit a harmful site. If this preference is disabled or not configured, a user can choose to visit a harmful site.

UserMessaging.title: Search Engine Installs from Websites
UserMessaging.description: Prevent installing search engines from webpages.

WhatsNew.title: What's New
WhatsNew.description: If enabled, remove the "What's New" icon and menuitem.

FeatureRecommendations.title: Feature Recommendations
FeatureRecommendations.description: If enabled, don't recommend browser features.

SkipOnboarding.title: Skip Onboarding
SkipOnboarding.description: If enabled, don't show onboarding messages on the new tab page.

UrlbarInterventions.title: URL Bar Interventions
UrlbarInterventions.description: If enabled, don't offer Firefox specific suggestions in the URL bar.

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.title: Legacy SameSite Cookie Behavior Enabled
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.description: Enable default legacy SameSite cookie behavior setting.

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.title: Legacy SameSite Cookie Behavior Enabled for Domain List
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.description: Revert to legacy SameSite behavior for cookies on specified sites.

WebsiteFilter.description: Block websites from being visited. The parameters take an array of Match Patterns, as documented in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Match_patterns. http/https addresses are supported as well as local file:// URLs. The arrays are limited to 1000 entries each.

Block.title: Block
Block.description: If this preference is enabled, you can specify match patterns that indicate sites to be blocked. The match patterns are documented at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Match_patterns. Only http/https addresses are supported at the moment. There is a 1000 entry limit. If this preference is disabled or not configured, no websites are blocked.

Exceptions.title: Exceptions
Exceptions.description: If this preference is enabled, and the website filter is enabled, you can specify match patterns for sites you do not want to block. The match patterns are documented at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Match_patterns. Only http/https addresses are supported at the moment. There is a 1000 entry limit. If this preference is disabled or not configured, there are no exceptions to the website filter.

AllowedDomainsForApps.title: Allowed Domains for Apps
AllowedDomainsForApps.description: Comma-separated list of domains allowed to access Google Workspace. This policy is based on the Chrome policy of the same name. If this policy is enabled, users can only access Google Workspace using accounts from the specified domains. If you want to allow Gmail, you can add 'consumer_accounts' to the list.

AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins.title: Auto Launch Protocols from Origins
AutoLaunchProtocolsFromOrigins.description: Comma-separated list of domains allowed to access Google Workspace. This policy is based on the Chrome policy of the same name. If this policy is enabled, users can only access Google Workspace using accounts from the specified domains. If you want to allow Gmail, you can add 'consumer_accounts' to the list.

CaptivePortal.title: Captive Portal
CaptivePortal.description: Enable or disable the detection of captive portals.

accessibility.force_disabled.title: accessibility.force_disabled
accessibility.force_disabled.description: If set to 1, platform accessibility is disabled.

app.update.auto.title: app.update.auto
app.update.auto.description: If false, Firefox doesn't automatically install update.

browser.bookmarks.autoExportHTML.title: browser.bookmarks.autoExportHTML
browser.bookmarks.autoExportHTML.description: If true, bookmarks are exported on shutdown.

browser.bookmarks.file.title: browser.bookmarks.file
browser.bookmarks.file.description: If set, the name of the file where bookmarks are exported and imported.

browser.bookmarks.restore_default_bookma.title: browser.bookmarks.restore_default_bookmarks
browser.bookmarks.restore_default_bookma.description: If true, bookmarks are restored to their defaults.

browser.cache.disk.enable.title: browser.cache.disk.enable
browser.cache.disk.enable.description: If false, don't store cache on the hard drive.

browser.cache.disk.parent_directory.title: browser.cache.disk.parent_directory
browser.cache.disk.parent_directory.description: If set, changes the location of the disk cache.

browser.fixup.dns_first_for_single_words.title: browser.fixup.dns_first_for_single_words
browser.fixup.dns_first_for_single_words.description: If true, single words are sent to DNS, not directly to search.

browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.defau.title: browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.default.sites
browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.defau.description: If set, a list of URLs to use as the default top sites on the new tab page.

browser.places.importBookmarksHTML.title: browser.places.importBookmarksHTML
browser.places.importBookmarksHTML.description: If true, bookmarks are always imported on startup.

browser.safebrowsing.malware.enabled.title: browser.safebrowsing.malware.enabled
browser.safebrowsing.malware.enabled.description: If false, malware protection is not enabled (Not recommended)

browser.safebrowsing.phishing.enabled.title: browser.safebrowsing.phishing.enabled
browser.safebrowsing.phishing.enabled.description: If false, phishing protection is not enabled (Not recommended)

browser.search.update.title: browser.search.update
browser.search.update.description: If false, updates for search engines are not checked.

browser.slowStartup.notificationDisabled.title: browser.slowStartup.notificationDisabled
browser.slowStartup.notificationDisabled.description: If true, a notification isn't shown if startup is slow.

browser.tabs.warnOnClose.title: browser.tabs.warnOnClose
browser.tabs.warnOnClose.description: If false, there is no warning when the browser is closed.

browser.taskbar.previews.enable.title: browser.taskbar.previews.enable
browser.taskbar.previews.enable.description: If true, tab previews are shown in the Windows taskbar.

browser.urlbar.suggest.bookmark.title: browser.urlbar.suggest.bookmark
browser.urlbar.suggest.bookmark.description: If false, bookmarks aren't suggested when typing in the URL bar.

browser.urlbar.suggest.history.title: browser.urlbar.suggest.history
browser.urlbar.suggest.history.description: If false, history isn't suggested when typing in the URL bar.

browser.urlbar.suggest.openpage.title: browser.urlbar.suggest.openpage
browser.urlbar.suggest.openpage.description: If false, open tabs aren't suggested when typing in the URL bar.

datareporting.policy.dataSubmissionPolic.title: datareporting.policy.dataSubmissionPolicyBypassNotification
datareporting.policy.dataSubmissionPolic.description: If true, don't show the privacy policy tab on first run.

dom.allow_scripts_to_close_windows.title: dom.allow_scripts_to_close_windows
dom.allow_scripts_to_close_windows.description: If false, web page can close windows.

dom.disable_window_flip.title: dom.disable_window_flip
dom.disable_window_flip.description: If false, web pages can focus and activate windows.

dom.disable_window_move_resize.title: dom.disable_window_move_resize
dom.disable_window_move_resize.description: If true, web pages can't move or resize windows.

dom.event.contextmenu.enabled.title: dom.event.contextmenu.enabled
dom.event.contextmenu.enabled.description: If false, web pages can't override context menus.

extensions.blocklist.enabled.title: extensions.blocklist.enabled
extensions.blocklist.enabled.description: If false, the extensions blocklist is not used (Not recommended)

extensions.getAddons.showPane.title: extensions.getAddons.showPane
extensions.getAddons.showPane.description: If false, the Recommendations tab is not displayed in the Add-ons Manager.

extensions.htmlaboutaddons.recommendatio.title: extensions.htmlaboutaddons.recommendations.enabled
extensions.htmlaboutaddons.recommendatio.description: If false, recommendations are not shown on the Extensions tab in the Add-ons Manager.

geo.enabled.title: geo.enabled
geo.enabled.description: If false, the geolocation API is disabled.

intl.accept_languages.title: intl.accept_languages
intl.accept_languages.description: If set, preferred language for web pages.

media.eme.enabled.title: media.eme.enabled
media.eme.enabled.description: If false, Encrypted Media Extensions are not enabled.

media.gmp-gmpopenh264.enabled.title: media.gmp-gmpopenh264.enabled
media.gmp-gmpopenh264.enabled.description: If false, the OpenH264 plugin is not downloaded.

media.gmp-widevinecdm.enabled.title: media.gmp-widevinecdm.enabled
media.gmp-widevinecdm.enabled.description: If false, the Widevine plugin is not downloaded.

media.peerconnection.ice.obfuscate_host_.title: media.peerconnection.ice.obfuscate_host_addresses.blocklist
media.peerconnection.ice.obfuscate_host_.description: If set, a list of domains for which mDNS hostname obfuscation is disabled.

network.dns.disableIPv6.title: network.dns.disableIPv6
network.dns.disableIPv6.description: If true, IPv6 DNS lokoups are disabled.

network.IDN_show_punycode.title: network.IDN_show_punycode
network.IDN_show_punycode.description: If true, display the punycode version of internationalized domain names.

places.history.enabled.title: places.history.enabled
places.history.enabled.description: If false, history is not enabled.

print.save_print_settings.title: print.save_print_settings
print.save_print_settings.description: If false, print settings are not saved between jobs.

security.default_personal_cert.title: security.default_personal_cert
security.default_personal_cert.description: If set to "Select Automatically", Firefox automatically chooses the default personal certificate. Other possible option is "Ask Every Time".

security.mixed_content.block_active_cont.title: security.mixed_content.block_active_content
security.mixed_content.block_active_cont.description: If false, mixed active content (HTTP and HTTPS) is not blocked.

security.osclientcerts.autoload.title: security.osclientcerts.autoload
security.osclientcerts.autoload.description: If true, client certificates are loaded from the operating system certificate store.

security.ssl.errorReporting.enabled.title: security.ssl.errorReporting.enabled
security.ssl.errorReporting.enabled.description: If false, SSL errors cannot be sent to Mozilla.

security.tls.hello_downgrade_check.title: security.tls.hello_downgrade_check
security.tls.hello_downgrade_check.description: If false, the TLS 1.3 downgrade check is disabled.

security.tls.enable_0rtt_data.description: If false, TLS early data is turned off.

security.tls.version.enable-deprecated.description: If true, browser will accept TLS 1.0. and TLS 1.1.

widget.content.gtk-theme-override.title: widget.content.gtk-theme-override
widget.content.gtk-theme-override.description: If set, overrides the GTK theme for widgets.

SupportMenu.title: Support Menu
SupportMenu.description: Adds a menuitem to the help menu for specifying support information.
